2. Councilmember Place 4 - Mayor Pro Tem

Councilmember Place 4 - Mayor Pro Tem
=====================================

Councilmember John Skier
------------------------

Councilmember Skier came to Richland Hills in 2006 to take advantage of the City's proximity to
airport and country culture. Councilmember Skier and his wife Lisa have three children and six grandchildren. Prior to his election to the Richland Hills City Council, he served on the Richland Hills Branding Committee and attended the Richland Hills Citizens Police Academy and Richland Hills Citizens Fire Academy. Outside of Richland Hills he serves as a member of Tarrant SKYWARN storm spotters and Hurst RACES, which provides event and emergency communications support to the City of Hurst and Tarrant County. Councilmember Skier's career started in Broadcast Television with
in St. John, Indiana, transitioned to computers and electronics with the
and developed into 40 years of developing systems to automate and integrate information and AI systems for commercial businesses, the military and municipalities. Councilmember Skier holds a Bachelor's Degree in Business from Auburn University, an Associate's Degree in Computer Science from Purdue University and an Associate's Degree in Electrical Engineering from the Community College of the Air Force.

Outside his work and council duties Councilmember Skier spends time volunteering with the Watch
program working with elementary students, doing construction and home improvement, and working on projects with his kids and grandkids. His hobbies center around electronics, computers, networks, radio systems and holiday light displays. He and his wife enjoy traveling, marathon race walking, water sports, snow skiing and water skiing.

Per the City of Richland Hills
Home Rule Charter (PDF)
, the duties of City of Richland Hills councilmembers are as follows:

Sec. 6.03. - Powers and duties of City Council.

The powers and duties herein conferred upon the City Council shall include but shall not be limited to the following:

(1) To appoint and remove the City Manager, City Attorney, Municipal Judge and relief Municipal Judges, and other such employees required by state law to be appointed by the City Council.

(3) To adopt the budget of the City.

B. Certificates of obligation subject to the notice, petition and election provisions as provided within V.T.C.A, Local Government Code ยง271041, the Certificate of Obligation Act.

(5) To inquire into the conduct of any office, department, or agency of the City and make investigation as to municipal affairs.

(8) To adopt and modify the official map of the City.

(9) To regulate, license, and fix the charges or fares made by any person owning, obtaining or controlling any vehicle of any character used for carrying of passengers for hire on the public streets and alleys of the City.

(11) To fix the salaries and compensation for the non-elective City officers and employees.

(13) May regulate burial grounds, cemeteries, and crematories and condemn and close any such burial grounds, cemeteries, and crematories in the thickly settled portions of the City when public interest or public health may demand, and may regulate interment of the deceased.
